name: The Occult Quarterly (IAPSOP)
content:
The Occult Quarterly (IAPSOP) About Archives Practices Contribute Contacts Search     Periodical: The Occult Quarterly Summary:  From Pat Deveney's database: Occult Quarterly, The. A Magazine For Spiritual Illumination. 1934--1935 Quarterly Chicago, IL. Editor: Royal Eugene Parks. 1/1, January-March, 1934. 50 cents a year, 16 pp. Parks ("Lecturer, Teacher, Healer") serialized his "Lessons on psychic unfoldment" in the journal and ran a Silent Healing Center from the same address as the journal, where he also sold incense, candles, and the like. Contribution by Effa Danielson (publisher of the Occult Digest), and advertisements for fringe mediums, "Emissaries of the Divine Light," healers, psychic readers, spiritualist counselors, and numerologists of the time. LOC Issues:Occult Quarterly V1 N1 Jan-Feb-Mar 1934 Occult Quarterly V1 N2 Apr-May-Jun 1934 Occult Quarterly V1 N3 Jul-Aug-Sep 1934 Occult Quarterly V1 N4 Oct-Nov-Dec 1934 Occult Quarterly V2 N1 Jan-Feb-Mar 1935 Occult Quarterly V2 N2 Apr-May-Jun 1935
